CARDINAL . ORG The opinion , dated DATE , was filed with the court on DATE . CARDINAL . ORG After a further hearing on DATE , the court decided on DATE that the property had the character of a " hereditary farm " and fixed its value , in accordance with the expert opinion , at CARDINAL ORG . This decision became final , as none of the parties appealed .

ORG The applicant appealed against this decision to ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) , claiming that certain evidence had been disregarded by ORG when refusing the exclusion of his CARDINAL - brother . He also submitted that the provision in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW giving precedence to legitimate children ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) had been abrogated by the new version of LAW , enacted in DATE , and by LAW . He requested the court to submit the question of the constitutionality of the provision to ORG ) .

CARDINAL . ORG dismissed the appeal on DATE . After confirming ORG finding that the applicant ’s CARDINAL - brother was not excluded , it stated that it had no doubts as to the constitutionality of the provision giving precedence to legitimate children . In its opinion , the provision had an objective justification because it was a peculiarity of the rural family and economic structure that legitimate children lived with the family on the farm , whereas illegitimate children were not infrequently brought up elsewhere and therefore did not have the same close link with the farm as legitimate children . This was also the situation in the present case . ORG therefore saw no reason to submit the issue of constitutionality to ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG The applicant appealed against this decision to ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) , adducing essentially the same arguments as before ORG . ORG rejected the appeal by a decision of DATE , on the ground that it was directed against a decision of ORG confirming a previous decision of ORG ; in such a case , an appeal is admissible only when a decision is clearly contrary to law or inconsistent with the file , or when there has been a procedural defect entailing nullity of the proceedings . As to the first condition , ORG denied that section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of GPE had been abrogated by LAW , as amended .
ORG also held that there was no reason to submit the matter to ORG , on the following grounds .

As regards the conformity of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) with the constitutional provision in LAW CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL ) was applicable only in relation to the enjoyment of the rights and freedoms set forth in the LAW . In its opinion , the LAW did not deal with the question of hereditary succession , and LAW No . CARDINAL ( PCARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , which secured the right to the peaceful enjoyment of possessions , did not exclude regulations providing for different rules of succession according to birth in wedlock or out of wedlock .

Furthermore , there was no doubt as to the compatibility of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) with the constitutional principle of equality . This principle required that legislation make no legal distinction based on the personal status of an individual unless this was justified by objective reasons . The impugned regulations in LAW did not , however , appear to be unjustified . Similar provisions also existed in the provincial legislation of GPE ( ORG ) and in the federal legislation for the other provinces ( Anerbengesetz ) and these limited illegitimate children ’s rights even further , in that they could take over a hereditary farm only if they had been brought up on it .

The preparatory materials on this legislation showed that the precedence accorded to legitimate children was based on convictions of rural society . Neither was the regulation in question contradicted by attempts to assimilate the legal position of illegitimate children to that of legitimate children , because it reflected the special convictions and attitudes of the rural population which , among other things , also affected the legal position of the widower . Furthermore , ORG observed , the family was an important element of the legal organisation of human relationships . Having regard to all these circumstances , it could not be said that the regulations contained in LAW were not based on objective considerations .

" Where there is CARDINAL heir , they shall be regarded , in respect of their joint right to inherit , as being CARDINAL person . CARDINAL . ORG The Carinthian Hereditary Farms Act , while leaving unaffected the general rules in LAW on the determination of hereditary shares , regulates the attribution of these shares in cash or in kind .
